isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine - Model Years Late 1997 to 2003 - Crankcase, Crankshaft, Connecting Rods, And Pistons - Connecting Rods, Pistons and Piston Rings - Assembly - Old Style Connecting Rod

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or possible death, wear safety glasses when installing piston pin retaining rings.

caution.para: Make sure the connecting rod and piston are assembled correctly to avoid engine damage. The large chamfer side of the connecting rod must be located next to the crankshaft fillet.
Make sure the lock slots and forging feature on the connecting rod are opposite the "CAM" marking found on the piston head.

figure.caption: Assembly of the Piston and Connecting Rod

calloutgroup.callout1: Piston Stamped "Cam", Part Number, (Service Pistons Include Oversize Designation)
Large Chamfer Side of Connecting Rod

step1.para: Connect the piston to the connecting rod as follows:

step2.para: Lubricate the piston pin bore in the connecting rod, the piston bore and the piston pin with clean engine oil.

figure.caption: Installing the Piston Pin Retaining Ring

note.para: The retaining ring has a smooth finish side and a rough finish side. The smooth finish side faces the piston pin.

step2.para: Use piston pin retaining ring pliers to install a piston pin retaining ring at one end of the piston pin bore.
Insert the connecting rod into the piston. Make sure the bored holes of the connecting rod and piston are aligned.
Slide the piston pin through the bored holes, stopping at the previously installed retaining ring.

step1.para: Use piston ring expansion pliers to install piston rings onto piston.
Install the oil control ring into the bottom piston groove.

note.para: The intermediate ring is identified by the two "OO" marks located on the top surface of the ring. The top ring is identified by one single "O" mark located on the top surface of the ring. Make sure the ring is installed with the identifications marks facing up.

figure.caption: Piston Ring Identification Mark (top ring shown)

step1.para: Use the piston ring expansion tool to install the intermediate ring into the middle piston groove.
Use the piston ring expansion tool to install the top ring into the top piston groove.
Space ring gaps approximately 120° apart after ring installation.
